squidpony.squidgrid.gui.swing

Class SwingPane

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JLayeredPane
            • squidpony.squidgrid.gui.swing.SwingPane
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, SGPane

    public class SwingPane
extends javax.swing.JLayeredPane
implements SGPane
    Displays text and images in a grid pattern. Supports basic animations. When text is placed, the background color is set separately from the foreground character. When moved, only the foreground character is moved.
    Author:
    Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SwingPane

        public SwingPane(int cellWidth,
         int cellHeight,
         int panelWidth,
         int panelHeight,
         java.awt.Font font)
        Builds a new panel with the desired traits. The size of the font will be used unless it's too large to fit, in which case it will be stepped down until the characters fit.
        Parameters:
        cellWidth - cell width in pixels.
        cellHeight - cell height in pixels.
        panelWidth - number of cells vertically..
        panelHeight - number of cells horizontally.
        font -

      • SwingPane

        public SwingPane()
        Empty constructor. One of the initialization methods must be called before this panel is used.

      • setText

        public void setText(char[][] chars)
        Sets the contents of the component to reflect the two dimensional character array. Will ignore any portion of the array that is outside the bounds of the component itself. The default colors of the foreground and background will be used.

      • placeImage

        public void placeImage(int x,
              int y,
              java.lang.String key,
              java.awt.Color background)
        Places the image associated with the provided key at the given coordinates. If the key does not have an associated image, the factory's default null image is used. The background will be set to the provided Color, but will only show up if the keyed image has transparency.
        Specified by:
        placeImage in interface SGPane
        Parameters:

        y -
        key -
        background -

        public void placeCharacter(int x,
                  int y,
                  char c)
        Sets one specific block to the given character. This block is not drawn immediately, refresh() must be called to update display.

        Parameters:

        y - The y coordinate to set
        c - The character to be displayed

      • initialize

        public void initialize(int cellWidth,
              int cellHeight,
              int panelWidth,
              int panelHeight,
              java.awt.Font font)
        Initializes the component with the supplied values. The cells will be set to the desired width and height and if the size of the font is too large, it will be shrunk until everything fits.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface SGPane
        Parameters:
        cellWidth - in pixels
        cellHeight - in pixels
        panelWidth - in cells
        panelHeight - in cells
        font -

      • initialize

        public void initialize(int panelWidth,
              int panelHeight,
              java.awt.Font font)
        Initializes the component with the supplied number of rows and columns. The size of the display will be adjusted to match the requested font size as closely as possible.

      • slide

        public void slide(java.awt.Point start,
         java.awt.Point end,
         int speed)
        Starts a sliding movement animation for the object at the given location at the provided speed. The speed is how many milliseconds should pass between movement steps.

        end -

      • waitForAnimations

        public void waitForAnimations()
        Causes the component to stop responding to input until all current animations are finished. Note that if an animation is set to not stop then this method will never return.
